utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So you see, what you’re eating is not technically yoghurt, because it doesn’t have enough live acidophilus cultures. It’s really just iced milk with carragenin added for thickness.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, that’s very interesting.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s also not pink and has no berries.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, but it doesn’t really answer my question.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What was your question again?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Do you want some.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, right, no, I’m lactose intolerant.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, gas.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Got it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, good night.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: There was a draft.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I didn’t feel a draft.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why don’t we just go into your….

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, you know what, maybe we should just slow things down a little.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, no, I didn’t mean to go into your apartment to… go fast.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, I know, I… I know what you meant, it’s just… it’s only our first date.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, okay, sure, no problem, why don’t we just figure out where we’re going, and when we want to get there, and then rate of speed equals distance over time. Solve for R.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Or we could just wing it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That might work too.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Goodnight Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Goodnight.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: He’s coming. Screen saver.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, hey, Leonard, how was your date?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Bite me. Sheldon, how could you just sit there and let them spy on me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: They were clever, Leonard. They exploited my complete lack of interest in what you were doing.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You should thank us. When future generations try to determine why your relationship with Penny crashed and burned, this right here is the black box.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you talking about, the date went fine.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Dude, she said she wants to slow things down.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, so, she said she wants to slow things down. It’s like saying “I’m really enjoying this meal, I’m going to slow down and savour it.”

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, it’s like “this fish tastes bad, so I’m going to slow down and spit it out.”

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You being the fish.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m not the fish.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh really, did you make a second date.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, we sort of decided to wing it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, even I know that’s lame.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, alright, let’s assume your hypothesis. We went to dinner, we talked, we laughed, we kissed, where could I have possibly gone wrong.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Think back, Leonard, the littlest things can set women off. Like, hey, the waitress is hot, I bet we could get her to come home with us. Or, how much does your mom weigh, I want to know what I’m getting into.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I didn’t say anything like that.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Good, ‘cos they don’t work.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: They also don’t care for it if you stare at them and hyperventilate. Sadly, that’s my home run swing.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Look, everything went fine. I didn’t even have to refer to my impromptu conversation starters. The woman across the hall is into me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Let’s go to the tape. Look at her reaction to the goodnight kiss, no change in respiration, pupils un-dilated, no flushing of the chest.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Nice close up, by the way.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Interesting, her jaws are clenched, no tongue access, clearly a bad sign amongst mating humans.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s not a bad sign.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Please, you might as well have been two iguana with no dewlap enlargement.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And the worst sign of all is, you’re here and not there.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m not there because I’m taking things slow. Which, by the way, compared to you guys approaches warp speed. And take down that camera.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: He was a lot more fun when he had no hope.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Give him time.

utterance.speaker: Penny (entering)
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, hi Penny. FYI, the hot water is inadequate on machine 2 so colours only, and 4 is still releasing the fabric softener too early in the cycle so I’d avoid using that for your delicates.

utterance.speaker: Penny (tipping all her laundry into one machine at once)
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, good Lord. Why don’t you just take your clothes down to the river and beat them with a rock?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, may I ask you a question?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I would prefer that you not, but I won’t go so far as to forbid it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Alright, I heard yes, so… okay, here’s my question, has Leonard ever dated, you know, a regular girl.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well I assume you’re not referring to digestive regularity? Because I’ve come to learn that such inquiries are inappropriate.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, I meant has he ever been involved with someone who wasn’t a braniac?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. Well, a few years ago he did go out with a woman who had a PhD in French Literature.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How is that not a braniac?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, for one thing, she was French. For another, it was literature.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, do you think that if Leonard and I keep dating he’ll eventually get bored with me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That depends.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: On what?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do you have a working knowledge of quantum physics?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do you speak Klingon?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do you know any card tricks?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, okay, you know, I get it, Leonard has no business being involved with a waitress slash actress who felt so insecure that she lied to him about finishing community college.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why would you lie about that?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, he was going on and on about this college and that grad school and I didn’t want him to think I was some stupid loser.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You thought the opposite of stupid loser was community college graduate?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, there are a lot of successful people in this country who are community college graduates.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, but you were neither.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Right, okay look, this is between you and me, you cannot tell Leonard any of this.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re asking me to keep a secret?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well I’m sorry, but you would have had to express that desire before revealing the secret, so that I could choose whether or not I wanted to accept the covenant of secret keeping. You can’t impose a secret on an ex post facto basis.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Secret keeping is a complicated endeavour. One has to be concerned not only about what one says, but about facial expression, autonomic reflexes, when I try to deceive, I myself have more nervous tics than a lyme disease research facility. It’s a joke. It relies on the hominymic relationship between tick the blood-sucking arachnid, and tic the involuntary muscular contraction. I made it up myself.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, look, if Leonard finds out that I lied, I will absolutely die of embarrassment.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Physiologically impossible.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh Sheldon, please, look, I’m asking you as a friend.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So you’re saying that friendship contains within it an inherent obligation to maintain confidences?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Interesting. See, one more question, and perhaps I should have led with this, when did we become friends?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I.e, I couldn’t become Green Lantern unless I was chosen by the guardians of Oa, but given enough start-up capital and an adequate research facility, I could be Batman.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You could be Batman?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sure. I’m Batman. See.

utterance.speaker: Penny (arriving)
utterance.content: Hi guys.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (looking the other way uncomfortably)
utterance.content: Hi Penny.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, Penny, if you’re not doing anything Friday night I thought maybe we could go and see a movie.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, um, you know, I think I have the dinner shift on Friday.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What about Saturday?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, I’m not sure, the manager hasn’t posted the schedule yet, how about I let you know.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Great. So you just let me know when you know. So… Oh God, I am the bad fish! What did I do wrong?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why are you asking me, I have no information about your interactions with Penny other than what you provided me, nor do I have any method of learning such things.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (chasing him)
utterance.content: What does that mean?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Nothing. You seem to be implying an informational back channel between me and Penny where obviously none exists.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No I didn’t.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I just think you need to be careful how you phrase things, sir.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What’s going on with you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well I might ask you the same question. Why do you insist on attempting to drag me into matters which have nothing to do with me? But exist between you and Penny. A person to whom I barely speak.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What’s wrong with your face?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There’s no reason to bring my looks into this. Good day, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I said Good Day!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Good day?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Also today we have a fresh caught Alaska salmon, and that’s served with a teriyaki glaze and sticky rice. Our soup of the day…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (appearing behind her)
utterance.content: You must release me from my oath.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, I’m working.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why don’t you take a minute to decide I can’t keep your secret Penny. I’m going to fold like an energy based anobo protein in conformational space. Like a renaissance triptych. Like a cheap suit.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, look, why is it so hard for you to keep one little secret?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m constitutionally incapable. That’s why I was refused clearance for a very prestigious government research fellowship at a secret military supercollider, located beneath a fake agricultural station 12.5 miles south east of Travers City, Michigan. Which you did not hear about from me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Look, just forget I told you about me not graduating from community college. Okay?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Forget! You want me to forget? This mind does not forget. I haven’t forgotten a single thing since the day my mother stopped breast feeding me. It was a drizzly Tuesday.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, look, you promised me you would keep my secret so you’re just going to have to figure out a way to do it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (entering)
utterance.content: Leonard, I’m moving out.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What do you mean, you’re moving out? Why?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There doesn’t have to be a reason.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, there kind of does.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not necessarily. This is a classic example of munchausen’s trilemma. Either the reason is predicated on a series of sub-reasons leading to an infinite regression, or it tracks back to arbitrary axiomatic statements, or it’s ultimately circular, i.e., I’m moving out because I’m moving out.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m still confused.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, I don’t see how I could have made it any simpler.

utterance.speaker: Howard (entering)
utterance.content: Hey, qu’est q’wass up?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We just got back from that exhibit of those plasticised human cadavers.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And some of those skinless chicks were hot.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If you’ll excuse me, I’m going to pack.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s kind of an overreaction to a little harmless necrophilia.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s not you, Howard, he says he’s moving out.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What did you do? Did you change the contrast or brightness settings on the television?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Did you take a band aid off in front of him?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Did you buy generic ketchup, forget to rinse the sink, talk to him through the bathroom door?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Adjust the thermostat, cook with cilantro, pronounce the T in often?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Did you make fun of trains?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I didn’t do anything, he’s just gone insane.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, we all knew this day was coming.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That was fast.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s my pre-packed disaster evacuation bag. Recommended by the department of homeland security. And Sarah Connor.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Where are you gonna live?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Until I find a permanent place I will stay with friends.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Bye

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well you can’t stay with me, I have a teeny tiny apartment.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me, but isn’t hosting guests an aspect of Menushya Yajna, one of the five central religious duties or sacrifices of the Hindu householder?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I hate trains.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Don’t be ridiculous, you love trains.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yes I do, come on. See you later Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: This could work.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This is a very old building.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sixty years. Used to be a watch factory.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh-oh.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Don’t you worry about the residual radium from the luminous dials?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Not until now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I can’t believe I didn’t bring my gieger counter. You know, I had it on my bed and I didn’t pack it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, if you’re not comfortable staying here, Sheldon…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m kidding, I packed it. It was a joke, I was subverting the conversational expectations. I believe they call that the, um, old switcheroo.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Terrific.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (referring to Bollywood singing on television)
utterance.content: Is that woman Aishwarya Rai?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yes, isn’t she an amazing actress.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Actually, I’d say she’s a poor man’s Madhuri Dixit.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: How dare you. Aishwarya Rai is a Goddess. By comparison Madhuri Dixit is a leprous prostitute.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sorry, I didn’t mean to offend you. Obviously you’re not that familiar with Indian cinema.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Who is it?

utterance.speaker: Voice
utterance.content: Strippergram.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Tag. You’re it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Shouldn’t you have put him in a brown paper bag and set him on fire?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ve never slept on an air mattress before. No lumbar support whatsoever.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Maybe you’d be happier on a park bench?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t see any way to get a park bench in here.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Do you want to switch?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, that’s fine. I’m perfectly comfortable sleeping on a bouncy castle.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Get out of bed, we’re switching.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Now, only if you want to.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Just get in the bed!

utterance.speaker: Howard’s mother (off)
utterance.content: What’s going on? Are you boys roughhousing?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We’re just talking ma.

utterance.speaker: Howard’s mother
utterance.content: If you don’t settle down right now, I’m not going to let you have any more sleepovers.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: For God’s sake, ma, I’m 27 years old. It’s not even a school night! Comfy now?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Meh. That poster of Halle Berry’s a little unnerving.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So don’t look at it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: She’s like my fourth favourite catwoman.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No kidding?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, Julie Newmar, Michelle Pfieffer, Eartha Kitt and then her.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What about Lee Meriwether?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I forgot about Lee Meriwether.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well I’m glad that’s settled.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That makes Halle Berry my fifth favourite catwoman. There’s Julie Newmar, Michelle Pfieffer, Eartha Kitt, Lee Meriwether…

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Please, I’m begging you, go to sleep.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m trying, I’m counting catwomen. She did make a fine mutant in the X-Men movies though.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh for God’s sake.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But she’s not my favourite of the X-Men, in order that would be Wolverine, Cyclops, oh wait, I forgot Professor X. Professor X, Wolverine, Cyclops, Iceman, then Storm, Angel, the Beast, oh wait, Nightcrawler. Professor X, Nightcrawler, Wolverine, Cyclops, Iceman, then Storm, Angel….

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m coming!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hey, there he is, there’s my old buddy-bud-bud.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What’s with him?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Koothrappali dumped him on me, and he couldn’t get to sleep, so I gave him a glass of warm milk with a handful of my mom’s valium in it. But he still wouldn’t shut up, so, tag, you’re it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m ba-ack!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I still don’t know why you left.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I can’t tell you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why not.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I promised Penny.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You promised Penny what?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That I wouldn’t tell you the secret. Shhhhh!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What secret. Tell me the secret.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Mom smokes in the car. Jesus is okay with it, but we can’t tell Dad.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Not that secret, the other secret.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m Batman. Shhhhh!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Dammit, Sheldon! You said Penny told you a secret, what was the secret.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, I’ll tell you, but you can’t tell Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I promise.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny lied about graduating from community college because she is afraid she’s not smart enough for Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So it’s nothing I did? It’s her problem?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I drank milk that tasted funny.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Penny thinks I’m too smart for her, that’s ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I know, most of your work is extremely derivative. Don’t worry, that’s not a secret. Everybody knows.

utterance.speaker: Penny (opening door)
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, hi, listen, I know what’s been bothering you about us, and I have the answer.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What are you talking about.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: First I want to say that it’s not Sheldon’s fault, he tried very hard to keep your secret, if Howard hadn’t drugged him he would have taken it to his grave.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: He told you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes, but it’s okay. Now that we know what the problem is, there’s a simple solution.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Pasadena city college?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: A place for fun, a place for knowledge. See, this man here’s playing hacky sack, and this girl’s going to be a paralegal.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wow, I get it, because Dr Leonard Hofstadter can’t date a girl without a fancy college degree.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, it’s really not that fancy, it’s just a city college.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Right, but I have to have some sort of degree to date you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That doesn’t matter to me at all.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, it’s fine with you if I’m not smart.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Absolutely. Okay, this time I know where I went wrong. Oh bite me!
